docs.snippet: 8 P.M. (NBC) THE 69TH ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS Ricky Gervais, above, returns for his third stint as host of these awards -- considered predictors of the Oscars -- sponsored by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association and broadcast live from the B...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (NBC) THE 69TH ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS Ricky Gervais, above, returns for his third stint as host of these awards -- considered predictors of the Oscars -- sponsored by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association and broadcast live from the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles. In the motion picture drama division, nominees include ''The Descendants,'' ''The Help,'' ''Hugo,'' ''The Ides of March,'' ''Moneyball'' and ''War Horse'' for best picture; Glenn Close, Viola Davis, Rooney Mara, Meryl Streep and Tilda Swinton for best actress; and George Clooney, Leonardo DiCaprio, Michael Fassbender, Ryan Gosling and Brad Pitt for best actor. In the comedy or musical division, the nominees are ''50/50,'' ''The Artist,'' ''Bridesmaids,'' ''Midnight in Paris'' and ''My Week With Marilyn'' for best picture; Jodie Foster, Charlize Theron, Kristen Wiig, Michelle Williams and Kate Winslet for best actress; and Jean Dujardin, Brendan Gleeson, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ryan Gosling and Owen Wilson for best actor. Morgan Freeman will receive the Cecil B. DeMille Award. Awards will also be handed out for television work. Coverage from the red carpet begins at 5 on E! and at 7 on NBC; E! will visit after-parties at 11. 9 A.M. (CNN) STATE OF THE UNION WITH CANDY CROWLEY Ms. Crowley speaks with the Republican presidential candidate Gov. Rick Perry of Texas, who appears on ''This Week With George Stephanopoulos'' at 10 on ABC. The comedian Stephen Colbert is also a guest.

docs.snippet: 8:30 P.M. (HBO) 24/7  Two lean, mean pummeling machines -- Roy Jones Jr. (52 wins, 4 losses, 38 knockouts), left,  of Pensacola, Fla., and Joe Calzaghe (45 wins, no losses, 32 knockouts) of Newbridge, Wales -- prepare for their long-anticipated he...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8:30 P.M. (HBO) 24/7 Two lean, mean pummeling machines -- Roy Jones Jr. (52 wins, 4 losses, 38 knockouts), left, of Pensacola, Fla., and Joe Calzaghe (45 wins, no losses, 32 knockouts) of Newbridge, Wales -- prepare for their long-anticipated heavyweight showdown on Nov. 8 in a new season of this boxing reality series. Three all-access matches between the men will be shown on Sunday, Nov. 2 and Nov. 6. The Nov. 8 match is a pay-per-view event broadcast live from Madison Square Garden. Liev Schreiber narrates. 10 A.M. (Fox) FOX NEWS SUNDAY WITH CHRIS WALLACE Gov. Tim Kaine of Virginia, Gov. Tom Ridge of Pennsylvania and Karl Rove, former White House senior adviser, talk about campaign strategy.
